meaningMnemonic: Remember 済む and how it means "to come to an end." This is like that, but slightly different. This is <vocabulary>to finish something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to settle something</vocabulary>, because this is when you're doing the coming to an end action. You can remember this because you're coming in to finish the score uno <reading>mas</reading> (ます) time. This is the last time.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with 済む, so if you know that you'll be able <vocabulary>to finish</vocabulary> this vocab.
